valsi.definition: time tense relation/direction: will [selbri]; after [sumti]; default future tense.
evidential: I expect - I experience - I remember.
evidential: I expect - I experience - I remember.
evidential: I expect - I experience - I remember.
$x_1=g_1$ (agent) marks $x_3=b_2$ with mark(s) $x_2=b_1$ of material $x_4=b_3$.
$m_1$ is a pattern of marks $m_2=b_1$ arranged according to structure $m_3$ on $x_4=b_2$ of material $x_5=b_3$.
forethought emphasis indicator; indicates next word is especially emphasized.
forethought emphasis indicator; indicates next WORD only, even if that word is a construct-indicating cmavo
valsi.notes: According to CLL 19.11, regular {ba'e} doesnt always emphasize just one word. If it is placed in front of a construct (e.g. {la}), it emphasizes the entire construct. {ba'ei} was designed especially for these cases.

valsi.definition: basti modal, 1st place replaced by ...
interval event contour: in the aftermath of ...; since ...; perfective | |----.
Converts PA into tense; in [number (usually nonspecific)] possible futures where [sumti (du'u)] is true
valsi.notes: Possible futures, given the actual past and present; what might happen. Cf. {mu'ei}.

valsi.definition: $z_1$ grows $b_1$ for purpose/goal $z_3$ to size/form $b_2$ from $b_3$.
$x_1$ is a nursery where $x_2$ grows to size/form $x_3$ from $x_4$.
discursive: exaggeration - accuracy - understatement.
discursive: exaggeration - accuracy - understatement.
discursive: exaggeration - accuracy - understatement.
$d_1$ whines/bitches about $d_2$ by uttering $b_2$.
$n_1=b_2$ is a spoken/uttered message about subject $n_2$ uttered by $n_3=b_1$ to intended audience $n_4$.
$t_1$ is $b_1$'s pronunciation of utterance $b_2$ under conditions $t_3$.
$x_1$ (agent) says $x_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_3$ through expressive medium $x_4$.
valsi.notes:
Unlike {cusku}, which can refer to other forms of expression, ba'usku refers only to talking.
Cf. {tavla}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ (phone/speech sounds) is a segment of utterance/speech stream $s_2=b_2$.
time tense: will be going to; (tense/modal).
Babylon.
time tense: future actuality; modal aspect.
time tense: will be then; (tense/modal).
$k_1$ is a hyperbola in $k_2$ at $k_3$ defined by set of points/properties $k_4$.
$b_1$=$k_1$ goes beyond destination $b_2$=$k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$x_{1}$ utters verbally/says/phonates/speaks [vocally makes sound] $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also voices; does not necessarily imply communication or audience; ('says' is usually {cusku}). See also {krixa}, {cusku}, {casnu}, {tavla}, {voksa}, {pinka}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a bridge to the beyond across $c_2$ between $c_3=b_3$ and $c_4=b_1$.
$d_1=b_1$ is a tusk of $d_2$ protruding beyond the mouth $b_3$ by amount $b_4$
$bi_1=ba_1$ is a rampart/[protective wall] protecting $bi_4=ba_2$ from threat/peril/potential $ba_3$ (event).
$g_1$ is a protective cover for $b_2=g_2$ against $g_3$.
$g_1$ causes event $b_1$ which defends/protects $b_2$ (object/state) from threat/peril/potential $b_3$ (event).
$bl_1=ba_1$ is a frigate/corvette of type/carrying $bl_2$, propelled by $bl_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a banana/plantain [fruit/plant] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is sad/depressed/dejected/[unhappy/feels sorrow/grief] about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$v_1$ is a fighter aircraft of type/for carrying $v_2$, propelled by $v_3$.
$x_1$ is a defensive building (castle, fortress etc.) for protection of $x_2$ from $x_3$ (enemies, danger).
$c_1=b_1$ is a bow that shoots arrow $c_2$ from string $c_3$, and is made of material $b_3$.
bapli modal, 1st place (forced by) forcedly; compelled by force ...
$x_1$ is an antelope (any of various bovids) of species $x_2$.
$b_1=c_1$ runs away from $c_2$ via route $c_3$ on surface $b_2$ using limbs $b_3$ with gait $b_4$.
$x_{1}$ runs on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$ with gait $x_{4}$.
$x_1$ is a budgerigar (Melopsittacus undulatus) of breed $x_2$
$b_1$=$j_1$ races against $j_2$ in race $j_3$ for prize $j_4$ on track $b_2$ with legs $b_3$ and gait $b_4$.
$k_1=b_1$ runs to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using limbs $b_3$ with gait $b_4$.
$j_1=b_1=p_1=r_1$ compete(s) in a track and field athletics match against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$j_3$ is a track and field athletics match with $j_1=b_1=p_1=r_1$ competing against $j_2$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$s_1=b_2$ is a running track.
$x_1$ is a cattle ranch at $x_2$ where farmer $x_3$ raises cattle $x_4$.
$x_1$ kills bull/cow $x_2$ by method $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a bundle/package/cluster/clump/pack [shape/form] containing $x_{2}$, held together by $x_{3}$.
$l_1$ is a musk ox of breed $l_2$ belonging to herd $l_3$.
$x_1$ is May of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a cow/cattle/kine/ox/[bull/steer/calf] [beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is Taurus [constellation/astrological sign].
valsi.notes: From bakni (=cow/cattle/kine/ox/[bull/steer/calf]; lojban); Taurus (=bull, bullock, steer; latin).

valsi.definition: $p_1$ plows $p_2$ with tool $p_3$ propelled by oxen/cattle of species/breed $b_2$.
$r_1$ is beef/bovine meat from species/breed $r_2=b_2$.
$p_1=r_1$ is beefsteak.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of chalk from source $x_{2}$ in form $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is the Cretaceous Era.
$t_1$ is a chalkboard.
$s_1$ is hide/leather of/from bovine $s_2=b_2$, of species $b_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a bucket/pail/can/deep, solid, wide-topped container of contents $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$.
$d_1$ is $d_2$ bucketfull(s) of contents $b_2$.
$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) bucketfuls in quantity.
$j_1$ is a cowbell producing sound/note $j_2$.
$x_1$ is a cowberry/lingonberry/blueberry/cranberry of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ plows, removing $x_2$ from $x_3$ using tool $x_4$ and oxen $x_5$.
$c_1$ is a university at $c_2$ teaching subject(s) $c_3$ to audience/community $c_4$ operated by $c_5$.
$xa_1$ is a great sword for use against $xa_2$ by $x_3$.
$g_1=b_1$ is an empire of peoples $g_2$ with land/territory $g_3$.
$j_1$ fights a great war against $j_2$ over territory/matter $j_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a bulb [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; [metaphor: rounded, bulgy].
$x_1$ is a clove of bulb $x_2$ of plant/species $x_3$.
$k_1$ is a Hall in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_1$ is a professor teaching audience $x_2$ ideas/methods/lore $x_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $x_4$ by method $x_5$ (event).
$x_{1}$ is a balcony/overhang/ledge/shelf of building/structure $x_{2}$.
$t_1=n_1=b_1$ is the emperor/empress/kaiser/tsar of peoples/territories $t_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a blade of tool/weapon $x_{2}$.
$s_1=b_1$ is a banquet/feast including dishes $s_2$, elaborate by standard $b_3$.
$s_1=b_1$ is a great soldier of army $s_2$ great in property $b_2$ (ka) by standard $b_3$.
$t_1=b_1$ is a realm belonging to/controlled by $t_2$, great in property $b_2$ (ka) by standard $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is in the future of/later than/after $x_{2}$ in time sequence; $x_{1}$ is latter; $x_{2}$ is former.
valsi.notes: Also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use {lidne} otherwise); aorist in that $x_1$ may overlap in time with $x_2$ as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= {cfabalvi}); (default $x_2$ is the space time reference, whereupon:) $x_1$ will occur. See also {lidne}, {cabna}, {purci}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $ba_1=be_1$ is an orchestra, consisting of performers $be_2$, and conducted by $be_3$, performing music $z_1=be_4$.
$x_1$ is a bamboo (Bambuseae) of genus/species $x_2$.
$v_1$ is a bomber carrying bomb $v_2=j_1$ with explosive material/principle $j_2$, aircraft propelled by $v_3$.
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''ben'' (Bengali).
$x_{1}$ exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ in property/amount $x_{4}$ (ka/ni).
valsi.notes: On the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per {ragve}); also not limited to position in space. See also {dukse}, {ragve}, {zmadu}, {kuspe}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''cmn'' (Mandarin Chinese).
$x_{1}$ (event) defends/protects $x_{2}$ (object/state) from threat/peril/potential $x_{3}$ (event).
valsi.notes: Also secures (verb); $x_1$ wards/resists $x_3$; protective cover/shield (= {badgai}). See also {ckape}, {fanta}, {fapro}, {marbi}, {rivbi}, {zunti}, {snura}, {binra}, {lunbe}, {pulji}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''deu'' (German).
$x_{1}$ is an amphibian of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''fra'' (French).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''ara'' (Arabic).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''arb'' (Standard Arabic).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''eng'' (English).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''epo'' (Esperanto).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''ind'' (Indonesian).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''ita'' (Italian).
$x_1$ is the Farsi language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Nigerian English language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Polish language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Italian language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Korean language of North Korea used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Turkish language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Vietnamese language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Korean language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Korean language of South Korea used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the Iranian Farsi language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_{1}$ is a/the language/dialect used by $x_{2}$ to express/communicate $x_{3}$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''ukr'' (Ukrainian).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''urd'' (Urdu).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''yue'' (Yue Chinese).
$s_1$ is sociolinguistics based on methodology $s_2$.
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''jbo'' (Lojban).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''jpn'' (Japanese).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''kan'' (Kannada).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''kor'' (Korean).
$x_{1}$ is great/grand in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for {barda}; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally {zabna}); terrible ({mabla}). See also {barda}, {nobli}, {se} {sinma}, {pluja}, {misno}, {vajni}, {fasnu}, {cizra}, {traji}, {mutce}, {se} {manci}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is psycholinguistics based on methodology $s_2$.
$s_1$ is pragmatics based on methodology $s_2$.
valsi.notes: The science of how language interacts with the world. Cf. {banjikske}, {banmenske}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''pol'' (Polish).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''por'' (Portuguese).
$s1$ pertains to language of $s2=b2$
valsi.notes: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for languages: From gismu {bangu} and {srana}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also rising, developing; $x_1$ gets bigger/enlarges/increases. See also {farvi}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {barda}, {makcu}, {ferti}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''rus'' (Russian).
$p_1$ is a linguist (scientist).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''spa'' (Spanish).
$t_1$ studies language $t_2=b_1$ used by $b_2$.
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''wuu'' (Wu Chinese).
$x_{1}$ is a bank owned by/in banking system $x_{2}$ for banking function(s) $x_{3}$ (event).
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''hin'' (Hindi).
Exact meaning uncertain, probably something like $b_1$ is a language-rose.
valsi.notes: Used as a title of one of Michael Helsem's poems in his book ``luryri'e'' (Moon River).

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ pays bribe $p_2$ to $p_3$ for favor/services $p_4=b_2$.
valsi.notes: Not necessarily with a negative connotation.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ [force] (ka) forces/compels event $x_{2}$ to occur; $x_{1}$ determines property $x_{2}$ to manifest.
valsi.notes: Also constrains; requires success, unlike the physics term (better expressed by {danre}). See also {fanta}, {rinju}, {jimte}, {jitro}, {rinka}, {krinu}, {zukte}, {randa}, {danre}, cmavo list {bai}, {marxa}, {tinsa}, {xarnu}.

valsi.definition: time tense: will have been; (tense/modal).
$x_1$ exports $x_2$ to $x_3$ from $x_4$ via $x_5$.
$c_1=b_1$ is a jacket of material $c_2$.
valsi.notes: Worn on the upper body outside a shirt or blouse, often waist length to thigh length. Cf. {creka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is big/large in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$f_1$ is inside-out, with part(s) $b_1$ currently on the outside.
$x_1$ is a stream of $x_2$ flowing out of $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ arches/curves over/around $x_{2}$ and is made of $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an arch over/around $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also arc; $x_2$ need not be an object, but may be a point or volume. See also {cripu}, {kruvi}, {korcu}, {condi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a tavern/bar/pub serving $x_{2}$ to audience/patrons $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ is a bartender at bar $b_1$, serving $b_2$ to audience/patrons $b_3$.
$j_1$ is a bar/café manager/owner of bar/café $j_2=b_1$.
$s_1$ is a bartender at bar $b_1$, serving $b_2$ to audience/patrons $b_3=s_2$.
$x_1$ is an exit/outlet/way out of $x_2$ for $x_3$.
$l_1=b_1$ is a monocle/pair of (eye)glasses/spectacles allowing the clear sight of $l_2$ (light) by $k_2$ (wearer).
$x_1=k_1$ exits/goes out/outside from $x_2=k_2=b_1$ with route $x_3=k_3$ with transportation method $x_4$.
valsi.notes: Omitted: x5 = klama2 (destination) = bartu1 (something external). Cf. {bartu}, {klama}, {zevykla}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ ejects $k_1$ from $b_2=k_3$ via $k_4$ using means $k_5$.
$x_1$ projects/extends out of $x_2$.
$x_1=c_1$ leaves/exits/goes outside of $x_2=c_2=b_2$ via route $x_3=c_3$.
$x_{1}$(s) is a/are mark(s)/spot(s) on $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: {ba'armo'a} for a pattern of marks. See also {sinxa}, {pixra}, {se} {ciska}, {se} {prina}.

valsi.definition: Barcelona
$x_1$ is a sense organ used to observe $x_2$ which is outside the observer $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is on the outside of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is exterior to $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an omnibus for carrying $x_2$ in medium $x_3$ propelled by $x_4$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {sorprekarce}; {pavloibasfa} for single-decker, {relyloibasfa} for double-decker {jonbasfa} for articulated, {clajonbasfa} for bi-articulated, {dizbasfa} for low-floor, {drucaubasfa} for open top, {kumbasfa} for coach, {dicybasfa} for trolleybus.

valsi.definition: $b_1=c_1$ is a pseudonym of $c_2$ to/used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$x_{1}$ emphasizes/accentuates/gives emphasis/stress/accent to $x_{2}$ by (action) $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ replaces/substitutes for/instead of $x_{2}$ in circumstance $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a replacement/substitute.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ trades places with $x_2$. See also cmavo list {ba'i}, {binra}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ (agent) replaces/substitutes $b_1$ for/instead of $b_2$ in circumstance $b_3$.
$x_1$ replace/trade places with one another in circumstance $x_2$.
$v_1=b_1$ is an anaphora/pronoun/pro-word in language $v_2$ replacing word $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ bites/pinches $x_{2}$ on/at specific locus $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$.
$b_1=f_1$ (agent) bites apart $b_2=f_2$ into sections/partitions $f_3$ with bite locus $b_3$.
$x1=b1=k1$ takes bite $x2=b3=k2$ out of $x3=b2=k3$ using teeth/implement $x4=b4=k4$
$x_{1}$ is a button/knob/[handle] on/for item $x_{2}$, with purpose $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$.
$c_1$ writes $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with keyboard $c_4$.
$x1=b2=f1$ is a keyboard for purpose $x2=b3$ of material $x3=b4$
$k_1$ is a buttonhole in $k_2=b_2$ for button $b_1$.
$m_1=b_1$ is chewing gum of type/composition $m_2$ in shape/form $m_3$.
bangu modal, 1st place in language ...
$c_1$ is the basis of language $c_2=b_1$ used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$c_1$ is a language expert of language $c_2=b_1$.
$k_1$ is a language type/category/subgroup/subset (linguistic taxon) within languages $b_1=k_2$, with typological features $k_3$.
$x_1$ uses language $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''gsw'' (Swiss German).
$s_1$ is linguistics based on methodology $s_2$.
$s_1$ is a split piece of language $b_1=s_2$.
$g_1=p_1$ thinks about/considers/ponders/reflects upon doing $b_1=g_2=p_2$ (nu) after $b_2$ (nu)
valsi.notes: I found that there was no good, single word for "thinking about doing ... after ...". (See {balvi}, {gasnu}, and {pensi})

valsi.definition: $b_1=l_1$ is next after $b_2=l_2$ in sequence $l_3$.
$n_1=l_1=b_1$ is the night after $b_2=l_2$ at location $n_3$.
$d_1=b_1=l_1$ is tomorrow; $d_1=b_1=l_1$ is the day following $b_2=l_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$j_1=b_1$ is the week after $b_2$ by standard $j_3$.
$x_1$ is the next/following time that $x_2$ happens.
$x_{1}$ is the evening of the next day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of barley [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$f_1$ ages / passes through time into future form $f_2 = b_1$ from current / past / earlier form $f_3 = b_2$ through stages $f_4$.
$x_1$ expects/anticipates $x_2$ to happen.
$p_1$ delays $p_2$ until after $b_2$.
$s_1$ is the fiancé(e)/betrothed of $s_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $s_3$.
$x1$ asserts/prophesies that $x_2=b_1$ is true about the future of $b_2$
$x_{1}$ reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
sumti link to attach sumti (default $x_{2}$) to a selbri; used in descriptions.
location tense relation/direction; north of.
$x_1$ is a daughter-in-law (son's wife) of $x_2$ according to law/custom $x_3$.
vocative: request to send/speak.
benji modal, 1st place (sender) sent by ...
elidable terminator: end linked sumti in specified description.
attitudinal modifier: lack/need - presence/satisfaction - satiation.
attitudinal modifier: lack/need - presence/satisfaction - satiation.
$c_1=b_2$ crawls on $c_2$.
attitudinal modifier: lack/need - presence/satisfaction - satiation.
$g_1$ is giddy about $g_2$.
$x_{1}$ is foolish/silly in event/action/property [folly] (ka) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a boob.
$b_1=z_1=p_1$ is a troll on $z_2$ with inflammatory message $z_3$.
valsi.notes: x2 is usually an internet bulletin board or newsgroup. Cf. {zunti}, {prenu}, {malzunpre}.

valsi.definition: $cr_1=cl_1=b_2$ is a crop top t-shirt / blouse of material $cr_2$.
valsi.notes: The lower portion is cut off, resulting in the exposure of some of the wearer's abdomen. Suggested shortest fu'ivla form: efcrka. Cf. {creka}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ has a bellyache.
$k_1=b_2$ burps.
$k_1$ is the abdominal cavity of $k_2$.
$p_1$ is the digestion of $p_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $b_2$.
$k_1$ is the navel of $k_2$.
$d_1$ is a belt of material $d_2$.
$t_1$ is the lower back [body-part] of $b_2$.
$be_1=ba_1$ is the navel / belly button (umbilicus) of $be_2=ba_2$.
valsi.notes: In humans, the navel can appear as a depression (kevna) or as a protrusion (punli). Cf. {befsfeke'a}, {betfu}, {barna}.

valsi.definition: $be_1=ba_1$ is the Bengali language used by $ba_2$ to communicate $ba_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$b_1=g_1$ is Bangladesh.
separates multiple linked sumti within a selbri; used in descriptions.
Beijing.
$b_1$ is a cargo ship for carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$.
$p_1=b_1$ is a carrier/porter/waiter, carrying $b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$.
$c_1$ is a cart/carriage/wagon (wheeled vehicle) for carrying $c_2=b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$, propelled by $c_3$.
Bethlehem.
$j_1$ plays American/Canadian football against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$j_3$ is an American/Canadian football match/game with $j_1$ playing/competing against $j_2$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$b_1$=$k_1$ is North America and South America; $b_1$=$k_1$ is Pan-American.
$x_{1}$ reflects North American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$b_1=t_1$ is North America.
$x_{1}$ is a crew/team/gang/squad/band of persons $x_{2}$ directed/led by $x_{3}$ organized for purpose $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_1$ is a mass; $x_2$ is a set completely specified); Also orchestra (= {zgibe'e}, {balzgibe'e}), outfit; $x_3$ conductor; business, not necessarily incorporated (= {cajbe'e}, {venbe'e}). See also {gunma}, {girzu}, {dansu}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {kagni}, {kamni}, {minde}, {ralju}, {cecmu}, {gidva}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Bengali/Bangladesh culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ transfers/sends/transmits $x_{2}$ to receiver $x_{3}$ from transmitter/origin $x_{4}$ via means/medium $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: Also possibly "sharing"; no (complete) alienation from origin is implied. x5 carrier. See also {muvdu}, {dunda}, {mrilu}, {nirna}, {xruti}, {cradi}, {tivni}, {preja}, cmavo list {be'i}, {bevri}, {mrilu}, {tcana}.

valsi.definition: $m_1=b_2$ is brain-dead.
$x_1$ is a meninx/mater of $x_2$.
$s_1$ is (cerebral) neurology/neuroscience with methodology $s_2$.
$v_1$ is the braincase (part of cranium) of organism $b_2$.
$xa_1$ is a hemisphere of brain $b_1=xa_2$.
$x_1$ is a bergamot orange of variety/cultivar $x_2$
$b_1=z_1$ is farther north than $b_2=z_1$ according to frame of reference $b_3$ by distance/gap/margin $z_4$.
$j_1$ is the latitude/declination of $j_2$ in system $j_3$.
$b_1=p_1$is the northern part of $b_2=p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a son of mother/father/parents $x_{2}$ [not necessarily biological].
$x_1$ is northwest of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_1$ is northeast of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_1$ is north by east of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is to the north/northern side [right-hand-rule pole] of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$m_1=b_2$ is the mother of son $m_2=b_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the brain [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: intelligence, mental control].

$x_1$ dons metaphorical asbestos suit $x_2$ to guard against flames $x_3$ on topic $x_4$ from $x_5$, who disagrees with post $x_6$ for reason $x_7$, not realizing that the post was meant to be sent to $x_8$ rather than all of mailing list $x_9$ (default jboste) where it was posted in response to email $x_{10}$, whose author wishes selma'o $x_{11}$ (default SE) were extended to concisely express place $x_{12}$ of brivla $x_{13}$ (default Besto) which has place structure $x_{14}$ and too many places because of sadistic whim $x_{15}$ of brivla-maker $x_{16}$, who also created brivla $x_{17}$ which has place structure $x_{18}$, and so winds up using too many of cmavo $x_{19}$ (default zi'o) in order to make the brivla ( $x_{13}$) more usable by standard $x_{20}$ and wishes they had never heard of the word besto for reason $x_{21}$, not realizing for reason $x_{22}$ that it was suggested sarcastically due to boredom $x_{23}$ of person $x_{24}$, who is proposing it against better judgement $x_{25}$ because it is fun by standard $x_{26}$, but still wishes it had as many places as $x_{27}$ (default du) for reason $x_{28}$, and feels like throwing in epistemology sumti $x_{29}$, because he/she knows both that gismu $x_{30}$ (default besto) has its place structure defined by run-on sentence $x_{31}$ and that epistemology sumti are used in gismu $x_{32}$ by epistemology $x_{33}$, notwithstanding the fact that $x_{34}$ actually has a use for besto places $x_{35}$ (default 1) through $x_{36}$ (default x7) and wishes this weren't an extremely long and stupid joke, longer than joke $x_{37}$ and stupider than joke $x_{38}$ but still appreciated by $x_{39}$ - a fact which says $x_{40}$ about them in the opinion of $x_{41}$ - but not seen as even remotely amusing by $x_{42}$, who is aware that $x_{43}$ has a use for the gismu besto because of $x_{45}$
valsi.notes: A joke gismu from http://www.lojban.org/tiki/e-mail+gismu Place x44 is absent for some reason

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: midsection].
valsi.notes: Also stomach (= {djaruntyrango}), digestive tract (= {befctirango}, {befctirangyci'e}). See also {cutne}, {livga}, {canti}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a tragedy/disaster/tragic for $x_{2}$.
$g_1$ is a/the transportation industry/sector for $b_1$ transporting $b_2$ from $b_3$ to $b_4$.
$m_1$ is a truck/transporter/cart/sled/mode of transport for carrying $m_2=b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$, on surface medium $m_3$, propelled by $m_4$.
$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) truckloads/lorryloads in quantity.
$x_{1}$ carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$ over path $x_{5}$; $x_{1}$ is a carrier/[porter].
valsi.notes: Alienation from $x_2$ to $x_3$ is implied. See also {marce}, {muvdu}, {benji}, {klama}.

valsi.definition: digit/number: 8 (digit) [eight].
$b_1=g_1$ has a fever due to disease $b_3$.
$s_1=b_1$ is sickly/appears ill with symptoms $s_2=b_2$ from disease $b_3$ to observer $s_3$.
$bin_1$ develops illness $bin_2=bil_1$ with symptoms $bil_2$.
$l_1$ is pus of composition $l_2$ from disease $b_3$.
$s_1$ (mass of facts) is the psychiatry of subject matter $s_2$ based on methodolgy $s_3$.
prefixed to a mex operator to indicate high priority.
non-logical interval connective: unordered between ... and ...
non-logical interval connective: ordered from ... to ...
discursive: newly introduced information - previously introduced information.
discursive: newly introduced information - previously introduced information.
$c_1$ is honey from bees $b_1$ of species $b_2$.
$x_1=b_1$ is the Indonesian language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$g_1$=$b_1$ is Indonesia.
Indonesia.
$x_{1}$ is a bead/pebble [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a rosary with beads of material $x_2$ with link properties $x_3$.
Belarus.
$c_1=b_2$ (agent) blows $c_2$.
$c_1$ is still/without wind.
$x_{1}$ is a bee/wasp/hornet of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$k_1$ (object) is fluttering on $k_2$ (object) at locus $k_3$.
$m_1$ is a windmill performing process $m_2$.
$c_1$ is a fan/blower/punkah blowing air/gas with speed $b_3$ by process $c_3$.
$g_1$ obligates $b_1$ to do $b_2$ by standard $b_3$.
$g_1$ is a formal organization with aim/purpose $g_2$.
$x_1=j_1$ is an office desk/counter of material $x_2=j_2$, in office $x_3=b_1$ of worker $x_4=b_2$ at location $x_5=b_3$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {briju} {jubme}. A table where transaction are made.

valsi.definition: number/quantity: 8,000 expressed with comma.
$x_{1}$ whips/lashes/snaps [a sudden violent motion].
$r_1$ flings/hurls/ throws violently $r_2=b_1$ to/at/in direction $r_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) snaps $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) at audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$.
$s_1$ snaps in response to person/object/event/situation/stimulus $s_2$ with response $s_3$.
$d_1$ is a whip (musical instrument).
$x_{1}$ is bound/obliged to/has the duty to do/be $x_{2}$ in/by standard/agreement $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ must do $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_3$ frame of reference. See also {zifre}, {fuzme}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is ill/sick/diseased with symptoms $x_{2}$ from disease $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is military/regimented/is strongly organized/prepared by system $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also paramilitary; soldier in its broadest sense - not limited to those trained/organized as part of an army to defend a state (= {bilpre}). See also jenmi for a military {force}, {sonci}, {ganzu}, {pulji}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is military police officer enforcing law(s)/rule/order $p_2$.
quantifier selbri: convert 8 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with the octet of members $x_{2}$.
quantified selbri: convert 8 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is eighth among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ is a mural representing/showing $p_2$, made by artist $p_3$ on wall $p_4=b_1$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Indonesian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
number/quantity: 80 [eighty].
number/quantity: 800 [eight hundred].
number/quantity: 8004, without comma.
$j_1=p_1$ is a middleman/mediator/contact/go-between/intercessor between parties $j_2$.
$x_{1}$ insures/indemnifies $x_{2}$ (person) against peril $x_{3}$ (event) providing benefit(s) $x_{4}$ (event).
valsi.notes: Also $x_3$ loss; sell/purchase insurance (= {binryve'u}), premium (= {binrydi'a}, or {binryvelve'u}). See also {bandu}, {cirko}, {betri}, {basti}, {bilma}.

valsi.definition: $j_1$ is an insurance premium providing coverage against peril $j_2$=$b_3$ for insured $j_3$=$b_2$ (person), offered by insurer $j_4$=$b_1$.
$v_1$ sells insurance $v_2=b_1$ to client $v_3=b_2$ for cost $v_4$, insurance against peril $b_3$ (event) providing benefit(s) $b_4$ (event).
$x_{1}$ becomes/changes/converts/transforms into $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Resultative, not-necessarily causal, change. (cf. {cenba} for non-resultative, {galfi} for causal, {stika} for non-resultative, non-causal change; {zasni})

valsi.definition: $c_1=b_1$ is an elbow of body $x_2=c_3=b_2$.
$k_1$ brachiates to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ cubit/cubits (length unit).
$j_1$ is a bracelet on arm $j_2=b_1$.
$x_{1}$ = $j_1$ grasps/holds/hugs $x_{2}$ = $j_2$ with $x_1$'s arms, at locus $x_{3}$ = $j_4$.
$x_1=j_1$ is a shoulder attaching arm $x_2=j_2=b_1$ of $x_3=j_3=b_2$ to $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a amount of beer/ale/brew brewed from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the arm [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: branch with strength].
valsi.notes: Also elbow (= {bircidni}), wrist (= {xanterjo'e}), appendage (but jimca, rebla preferred). See also {jimca}, {janco}, {xance}, {rebla}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an apricot of variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ is an armchair.
$p_1$ is a sleeve of garment $p_2=t_1$ for wearing by $t_2$ (gender/species).
$x_{1}$ is certain/sure/positive/convinced that $x_{2}$ is true.
$t_1$ is a sleeve of material $t_2$ for the arm of $b_2$.
$c_1$ (garment) is sleeveless.
$j_1$ arm-wrestles with $j_2$ for prize $j_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains ice [frozen crystal] of composition/material $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Composition including $x_2$, which need not be a complete composition. See also {kunra}, {runme}, {lenku}, {krili}, {bratu}, {snime}, {carvi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an iceberg in ocean $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a glacier of land mass $x_2$, draining snowshed $x_3$ into $x_4$.
$b_1=c_1=p_1$ is a comet revolving around $p_2$ with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$, with ice composition $b_2$.
$x_1=b_1=l_1$ is ice cream/frozen yoghurt made from milk of source $x_2=l_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a wall/fence separating $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$ (unordered) of/in structure $x_{4}$.
$g_1$ convinces/persuades $b_1$ that $b_2$ is true.
$k_1$ is a byte/octet.
August.
$x_1$ is August/the eighth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$j_1$ has the rank of Lieutenant General/Vice Admiral/Air Marshal (equivalent of NATO OF-8) in military unit /organization $j_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {bi}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {sozmoija'a}, {zelmoija'a}. Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.

valsi.definition: Neptune.
$p_1$ is the eighth closest planet (default is Neptune if p2 is the Sun) revolving around $p_2$ (default is the Sun), with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
$b_1=m_1$ is adolescent / pubescent / maturing in development-quality $m_2$ (ka) by standard $x_3$.
$x1=b3=g1$ makes/turns $x2=b1$ into $x3=b2$
$x_{1}$ is white/very-light colored [color adjective].
valsi.notes: Pale forms of other colors are a compound of white; e.g. pink (= {labyxu'e}, {xunblabi}) (whereas kandi is used for pale = dimness, lack of intensity). See also {skari}, {xekri}, {grusi}, {kandi}, {manku}, {carmi}, {bakri}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

valsi.definition: Belarus.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains glass of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is indigo (Indigofera sp.) of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is blue [color adjective].
$c_1$ is blue-green.
$x_1$ is a sloe [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$
$x1=r1=f1$ droops to $x2=f2$ from $x3=f3$ in frame of reference $x4=f4$
$x_{1}$ is a block [3-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, surfaces/sides $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_3$ sides/surfaces should include number, size, and shape; also polyhedron (= {pitybli} having flat/planar sides/surfaces). regular polyhedron (= {kubybli}, {blikubli}), brick (= {kitybli}); See also {tapla}, {kubli}, {tanbo}, {canlu}, {kojna}, {sefta}, {bolci}, {kurfa}, {tarmi}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is a relief/embossment representing/showing $p_2$, made by artist $p_3$, on material $b_2$.
$t_1$=$d_1$=$bo_1$=$bl_2$ is a wakeboard of material/property $t_2$.
valsi.notes: From {tanbo}, {djacu}, {boxna}, {bloti} (bo2-bo5,bl2, bl3 subsumed). See also sufingboard (={bonjacta'o}), windsurfingboard (={fanjacta'o}), kitesurfingboard (={volfanjacta'o}), wakesurfingboard (={blobonjacta'o}).

valsi.definition: $g_1=c_2=b_3$ is a punting pole made of $g_2$ pushed by $c_2$ in boat $b_1$.
$g_1=l_2=b_3$ is an oar made of $g_2$ pulled by $l_2$ in boat $b_1$.
$c_1$ is a prow of boat/ship $c_2=b_1$, boat for carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$.
$g_1=b_3$ is the mast made of $g_2$ of sail $f_1$ on boat $f_3=b_1$.
$g_1$ is the tiller made of $g_2$ of boat/ship $f_2=b_1$.
$p_1$ ferries through $p_2$ to destination side $p_3$ from origin side $p_4$, carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$.
$j_1$ is a captain of boat/ship $b_1$ of type/that carries $b_2$.
$k_1$ goes/sails/navigates (travels by boat) to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using boat $k_5=b_1$.
$k_1$ is the maritime culture of nation/ethos $k_2$.
$l_1=b_2$ travels by boat via route $l_2$ using boat/ship/vessel $l_3=b_1$ propelled by $b_3$.
$g_1=b_3$ is the shaft made of $g_2$ of engine $m_1$ in boat $m_2=b_1$.
$g_1$ is an oar/paddle of boat/ship/vessel $b_1$, of material $g_3$, boat for carrying $b_2$.
$g_1=b_3=p_1$ is a/the boom/yard made of $g_2$ of sail $f_1$ on boat $f_3=b_1$.
$p_1$ is a sailor of boat $b_1$ of type/that carries $b_2$.
$s_1$ maneuvers/is a pilot of boat $b_1=s_2$.
$s_1$ is a marine of military unit $s_2$.
$s_1$ is a fleet (of ships).
$t_1$ is a seaport/ferry terminal in transport system $t_2$ for boats/ships/vessels of type $b_2$ propelled by $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a boat/ship/vessel [vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$l_1=b_2$ is a pirate aboard pirate ship $b_1$, stealing $l_2$, which is wrong according to $z_2$.
$x_1$ is anemic of type $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$cir_1$=$cib_2$ loses blood $cib_1$=$cir_2$ under conditions $cir_3$; $cir_1$=$cib_2$ bleeds.
$f_1$ is blood flow/circulation of vital fluid $f_2=c_1$ of organism $c_2$, flowing in direction to/towards $f_3$ from direction $f_4$.
$x_1$ is a pair of jeans / blue jeans
$p_1$ is a vampire / drinks blood of organism $p_3=c_2$.
$x_1$ is a mosquito/blood-sucking diptere of genus/species $x_2$.
$t_1$ is a vessel with blood/vital fluid $c_1$ of organism $c_2$.
short scope joiner; joins various constructs with shortest scope and right grouping.
Bodhgaya.
$k_1=b_1$ is a cloak/cape of material $k_2=b_2$
valsi.notes: An essentially flat piece of fabric worn fastened or tied around the neck, and reaching down the back.

valsi.definition: $b_1=s_1$ is a sticky patch which sticks to $s_2$, and consists of material $b_2$.
$x_1$ is calcium.
$b_1=g_1$ is a skeleton with function $b_2$.
$k_1$ is the spine of $b_3$. $b_3$ is a vertebrate.
elidable terminator: terminate numeral or letteral string.
$j_1=b_1$ is a pearl/ball-shaped gem from gemstone/material/source $j_3=b_2$.
$bi_1$ rolls up under condition $bi_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a ball/sphere/orb/globe [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a spherical object [made of $x_{2}$].
$d_1$ is a dome/cupola for purpose $d_2$.
$xa_1=g_1$ is a mace for use against $xa_2$ by $xa_3$, of material $g_2=b_2$.
$x_1$ is Bulgarian in aspect $x_2$.
$j_1=g_1$ (team) competes in a ball game tournament with $j_2$ (team) in contest/competition $j_3$ (event) for gain $j_4$.
$g_1$ plays bowling/boules.
$k_1$ plays ball using $k_2$.
$j_3$ is a soccer match/game with $j_1=t_1$ playing/competing against $j_2$ for prize/title $j_4$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {bolci}, {tikpa}, {jivna}, {boltipyjvi}, {boltipyboi}. For American/Canadian football match/game see {bemboiterjvi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a soccer ball made from material $x_{2}$.
$j_1=t_1$ plays soccer against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$xa_1=b_1$ is the fist of $xa_2$.
$xa_1$ is a hemisphere of sphere $b_1=xa_2$, of material $b_2$, halfness standard $xa_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the bone/ivory [body-part], performing function $x_{2}$ in body of $x_{3}$; [metaphor: calcium].
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is likely an abstract: may be structure/support for some body part, but others as well such as the eardrum bones; the former can be expressed as (tu'a le RefEntity "lt"body-partRefEntity "gt"); cartilage/gristle (= {ranbo'u}), skeleton (= {bogygreku}). See also {greku}, {denci}, {jirna}, {sarji}.

valsi.definition: $t_1$=$d_1$=$b_1$ is a surfingboard of material/property $t_2$.
valsi.notes: From {tanbo}, {djacu}, {boxna} (b2-b5 subsumed). See also {jacta'o}, windsurfingboard (={fanjacta'o}), kitesurfingboard (={volfanjacta'o}), wakesurfingboard (={blobonjacta'o}).

valsi.definition: $p_1=j_1$ is corrugated cardboard from source $p_2$.
$m_1$ is an antenna emitting/receiving wave $b_2=m_2$ with wave-form $b_3$, wave-length $b_4$ and frequency $b_5$.
Bosnia.
$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) bottlefuls in quantity.
$x_{1}$ is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$ with lid $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sheet/foil/blanket [2-dimensional shape/form flexible in 3 dimensions] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wave [periodic pattern] in medium $x_{2}$, wave-form $x_{3}$, wave-length $x_{4}$, frequency $x_{5}$.
$bar_1=bak_1$ is a swimming pool filled with $bak_2$, made of material $bak_3$.
$bi_1=ba_1$ grows in size/becomes big to $bi_2$ under conditions $bi_3$.
$ba_1=bl_1$ is a ship for carrying $bl_2$, propelled by $bl_3$, big by standard $ba_3$.
$b_1$ is huge/enormous/very big in property $b_2$ with criterion $b_3$.
$c_1=b_1$ is a giant of mythos/religion $c_2$, huge as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$bl_1=ba_1$ is a battleship of type/carrying $bl_2$, propelled by $bl_3$.
$x_1=b_1=c_1$ is huge/enormous/colossal/immense in property $x_2=b_2$ to observer $x_3=b_3=c_3$
$c_1$ is a boot for covering/protecting (feet/hooves) $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an enemy/opponent/adversary/foe of $x_{2}$ in struggle $x_{3}$.
$f_1=b_1$ is an abyss in $f_2$, large as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$f_1=b_1$ is a novel about plot/theme/subject $c_2$ by author $c_3$.
$bl_1=ba_1$ is a cruiser of type/carrying $bl_2$, propelled by $bl_3$.
$g_1$ causes $j_1=b_1$ to decrease in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka) by amount $j_3$.
$c_1$ is the nail of the big toe of body $d_3$.
$k_1$ amply overlaps with $k_2$ at locus $k_3$, amply as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$k_1$ is numerous on a scale of $k_3$.
$b_1=c_1$ is a mountain in terrain $c_2$, big by standard $b_3$.
$z_1$ is bigger than $z_2$ in dimension $b_2$ by margin $z_4$.
$m_1$ is smaller/[less big] than $m_2$ in dimension $b_2$ by margin $m_4$.
$x_1$ is a grapefruit/shaddock/pomelo of variety $x_2$.
$p_1$ is a cauldron/big pot for contents $p_2$, of material/properties $p_3$, big as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$d_1=b_1$ is a continent in ocean/on planet $d_3$.
$t_1=b_1$ is the biggest among set/range $t_4$ in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka).
$r_1$ is a boulder/big rock of type/composition $r_2$ from location $r_3$, big as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$x_1$ is a greater noctule bat (Nyctalus lasiopterus)
$s_1$ is steep with angle $s_2$ to horizon/frame $s_3$.
$m_1=b_1$ is very big/great/huge/enormous in the property of $b_2$(ka) as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$t_1$ is a tone high in pitch/frequency from source $t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is hail/sleet/freezing rain/solid precipitation of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: This is the substance, not the act or manner of its falling, which is carvi. See also {carvi}, {snime}, {bisli}, {tcima}.

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a large container, containing $v_2$, large as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$x_1=b_1$ is an ocean on planet $x_2$ (default Earth) of fluid $x_3$.
Ocean
$x_1=b_1$ is a cart/dray/draft horse of breed $x_2$.
$j_1$ is a crab of species/section $j_2$.
$z_1=b_1$ grows in property $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$g_1$ causes $z_1=b_1$ to increase in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.

$x_{1}$ reflects Brazilian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is Breton in aspect $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is ready/prepared for $x_{2}$ (event).
$g_1$ prepares/readies $b_1$ for $b_2$.
$j_1=b_1$ is almost ready for $b_2$ (event).
$x_1$ is a patent on invention $x_2$ by inventor $x_3$ valid in jurisdiction $x_4$ for time interval $x_5$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a predicate relationship with relation $x_{2}$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ are related by relation $x_2$ (= {terbri} for reordered places). ($x_3$ is a set completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a breeze/wind/gale from direction $x_{2}$ with speed $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ blows from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an office/bureau/work-place of worker $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a pro-bridi representing predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a prenex of bridi/predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a bridi-tail of predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$v_1$ is a morphologically defined predicate word signifying relation $b_2$ in language $v_3$.
valsi.notes: Derived from {bridi} and {valsi}, deleting $b_3$, as we are speaking of the relationship independent of particular arguments. In Lojban, such words must end in a vowel and contain a consonant cluster within the first five letters (not counting y). Not all words that can be used as a selbri (for instance members of GOhA) are brivla.

valsi.definition: 1st assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).

$x_1$ is a bromeliad/pineapple of species $x_2$.
$xe_1=p_1$ is a Jew/Hebrew/Israelite.

$x_{1}$ is brother of/fraternal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necess. biological].

location tense relation/direction; coincident with/at the same place as; space equivalent of ca.

valsi.notes: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {grake}, {junta}, {tilju}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {kramu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is brown/tan [color adjective].
